speaker: Bloggers
vclaim: The photograph shows the members of the convoy of immigrants who are dragging a Mexican official.
date: stated on October 30, 2018 in a post on Facebook:
title: The viral picture shows that the Mexican police were withdrawn from 2014, not the immigration convoy.
text: Recently, bloggers abused an old picture of blood-stained police officers to wrongly claim that immigrants in the convoy walking to the American-Mexican border were torturing Mexican policemen. They are now abusing another image of a Mexican official. "The Mexican official is drawn by the convoy," reads the text over a picture of what looks like an officer being dragged along by men with covered faces. "Anybody above the open border?" The photo was posted on Facebook on 30 October and shared more than 930 times. This story was highlighted as part of Facebook ' s efforts to combat false news and misleading information in the broadcast of the news. ∙ (Read more about our partnership with Facebook.) Facebook was published on January 11, 2021 in Facebook, Nancy Belusi, who was no longer the Speaker of the House of Representatives by Samantha Buterman on January 12, 2021. The photo was already taken in Acapulco in 2014, when Mexican police were injured during protests against the disappearance of 43 student teachers. Sixteen officers were injured, according to the guard. The photographer Pedro Pardo took the picture of Getty. The account that went with the photo in the story of the guard: "The demonstrators are holding a riot police officer during the clashes following a demonstration in Acapulco." We're assessing this pants mail on fire! Sharing the facts of 2018-11-03 15:54:28 UTC PoliticsFact 1 1 7 PoliticsFact Dating: Pants on Fire Vocuk exposes members of the convoy of immigrants who are dragging a Mexican official.
